items.title: Around 40 people dead in Swiss ski resort blaze as survivors blame sparklers
items.description: Swiss authorities say "a large number of young people" are among the casualties from a fire at the Crans-Montana ski resort, as work continues to identify "dozens" of dead bodies.

items.title: Australian property market hits first snag in years
items.description: The red-hot Australian housing market is showing the first signs of easing since interest rates started rising back in May 2022.

items.title: More than 120 business leaders call for Bondi attack royal commission
items.description: Former Reserve Bank governors and CEOs are among 125 business leaders now calling for a Commonwealth royal commission in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

items.title: Massive stone statues 'walked' across Easter Island, researchers say
items.description: A study using 11,600 aerial drone photos to map a mountainous quarry in 3D reveals more about how the island's famed stone sentinels were created and moved to their final resting places.

items.title: 'A hunger revolution': Inside the massive protests sweeping Iran
items.description: Protests spread from capital Tehran to other cities and across other demographics, with people demanding Iran's leaders end the country's clerical rule and hold free elections.

items.title: Russia says 20 killed in Ukrainian strike in occupied Kherson region
items.description: It comes as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russia is bringing the conflict "into the new year" with a barrage of drone strikes on the country's energy infrastructure.

items.title: This crowded house sits on a huge property, but a second home is not allowed
items.description: The days when New South Wales councils decide if a second home or a granny flat is built on the state's largest properties could be numbered.

items.title: New year, new tattoo? Here are the emerging health risks to consider
items.description: While most people worry about the pain of tattooing, studies suggest that being inked — and removing ink if you change your mind — may increase the chance of health issues down the track.

items.title: Why is the Darling Downs Queensland's storm nursery?
items.description: Queensland's Darling Downs records more severe storm warning days than any other region this season — and meteorologists say it is no coincidence.

items.title: Three drownings at NSW beaches in 'terrible' start to new year
items.description: A man and two women have died and two people are missing following four separate incidents on Sydney waters over the past 48 hours.

items.title: Add these must-do regional festivals to your 2026 calendar
items.description: From pint-sized penny farthings to tuna tosses, a beer can regatta to the Running of the Sheep, there's a regional festival for everyone's interests.

items.title: Vacancies, drugs and graffiti dim iconic Melbourne strip — until now
items.description: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

items.title: Amyl and the Sniffers singer sues photographer over fine art prints
items.description: Punk rock frontwoman of Amyl and the Sniffers Amy Taylor has filed a lawsuit against an American photographer alleging that photos taken for a magazine photo shoot are being sold against her wishes and without her permission.

items.title: The bizarre political-legal drama unfolding in SA’s South East
items.description: The lower house of South Australia's parliament has two representatives from the Limestone Coast. Both are now in custody.

items.title: Man, 34, charged with 66 offences after police hunt in Latrobe Valley
items.description: Police charge a man after a two-day pursuit that resulted in a police officer being injured and multiple police vehicles being rammed.

items.title: Teen dies after e-bike crashes into pole on New Year's Eve
items.description: A 15-year-old boy has died in an e-bike crash on New Year's Eve, described by Tasmanian police as "tragic" and prompting a call for riders to comply with the law.

items.title: The Yorkshire Ripper’s reign of terror ended in a striking confession
items.description: The Yorkshire Ripper's reign of terror began in the 1970s and lasted for six years. In the end, he was caught by chance.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as NYC mayor with midnight subway oath
items.description: Zohran Mamdani is officially sworn in as major of New York City in a midnight, underground ceremony, with a more public affair to take place in hours time on the steps of City Hall.

items.title: Do focus apps actually improve your productivity?
items.description: To understand whether these apps are worth our while, we first need to consider why staying focused is so difficult in the first place.

items.title: Australian K-pop idol Danielle dropped from NewJeans and sued by label
items.description: An Australian K-pop idol caught up in a bitter dispute with her former record label is sued for more than $44 million and dropped from her group.

items.title: Banged-up Millennium Falcon the last boat to finish Sydney to Hobart
items.description: A boat named after a Star Wars spacecraft is the final entry to finish the Sydney to Hobart yacht race, after facing a range of issues at sea and extremely rough weather.

items.title: 'I need revenge': Sabalenka targets Kyrgios rematch
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka does not want her "Battle of the Sexes" clash with Nick Kyrgios to be the last and insists exhibitions have a vital role to play in tennis.

items.title: New York City rings in new year with famous ball drop
items.description: Cities around the world have rung in the new year in spectacular style, with fireworks lighting up famous landmarks from the London Eye to Egypt's pyramids.

items.title: Planning to travel overseas in 2026? These law changes might affect you
items.description: From currency changes to cleaner toilets, here's what is changing around the world in the new year.

items.title: World's first coin of 2026 celebrates 60 years of decimal currency in Australia
items.description: Hundreds of coin collectors forwent the late-night revelry of New Year's Eve in favour of an early morning visit to the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra, hoping to get their hands on the highly sought-after first coin of the year.
